description: POST endpoint for password vault authentication. Accepts password parameter and validates against MD5 hash. Returns HTML page with MD5 hash of submitted password displayed in error message, indicating client-side or transparent hash validation vulnerability.
notes: Critical security issue: Application returns MD5 hash of submitted password in the response ('Incorrect Vault Password: [MD5_HASH]'). This leaks the MD5 hash of user input and enables rainbow table attacks or online hash cracking. MD5 is cryptographically broken and unsuitable for password hashing. No password complexity requirements observed. No rate limiting evident - rapid sequential submissions accepted without delay or blocking. Test submissions: 'test' -> 098f6bcd4621d373cade4e832627b4f6, 'admin' -> 21232f297a57a5a743894a0e4a801fc3, 'password' -> 5f4dcc3b5aa765d61d8327deb882cf99, empty string -> d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e. Correct password unknown but vulnerable to brute force attack given: (1) No rate limiting, (2) MD5 hash exposure enabling pre-computation, (3) No account lockout mechanism."
